subject: Re: Simsonn PRO Plus upgraded
description_text:
What is the difference between plus x and pro plus? But the original question was if you have upgraded pro plus available somewhere else? Sent from my iPhone On May 29, 2025, at 15:38, General and sales enquiries <service@simsonn.com> wrote: ﻿ The Polish warehouse has a few sets of silver pro plus pedals, but we recommend you get the plus x, which is a huge upgrade. 
 ----------Reply to Message---------- 
 On Thu, May 29, 2025 20:29 PM Tanel Kobrusepp<tanel.kobrusepp@gmail.com> wrote: 
 

 Hi I will tey to get a refund through Aliexpress. I would still like to order the pedals so do you have them in stock at all or all the warehouses are out of stock? Best, Sent from my iPhone On May 29, 2025, at 09:28, service@simsonn.com wrote: ﻿
 Dear, can you provide us with the order number or you can contact customer service directly on the AliExpress platform. 
 
 service@simsonn.com 
 From: Tanel Kobrusepp Date: 2025-05-28 19:55 To: service Subject: Simsonn PRO Plus upgraded Hi After I ordered and paid for the Simsonn Pro Plus UPGRADED pedal set in Aliexpress (Poland), the reseller said they are out of stock and can not complete the order. It's frustrating since they accepted the order and money was charged. Before I fill in the order on your website I want to make sure you have the pedal set in stock. Do you have the Simsonn Pro Plus Upgraded pedal set in stock? Kind regards,-- Tanel Kobrusepp

conversations.body_text:
Where can I order the Plus X from? Aliexpress shows no listings.

Kind regards,

Kontakt Tanel Kobrusepp (<tanel.kobrusepp@gmail.com>) kirjutas kuupäeval P,

你好，Tanel Kobrusepp，  PlusX 主要在面板厚度和整体结构强度方面进行了升级，并改进了真液压系统和刹车阻尼系统，同时支持振动马达功能。

Hi

I just received my simpson Plus X pedals.
Unfortunately for me, there is not enough travel of the break pedal and it
feels too stiff. Do you have any recommendations for improving it?

Video is attached.

Kind regards,

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,    The brake pedal allows you to adjust the travel range by modifying the mechanical limit. According to the manual, using 3 red dampers provides the longest travel and the softest feel. Of course, we recommend testing it with your foot to better evaluate the actual force feedback.  Our damper combinations have been carefully tested and optimized. You can also set your desired brake force range in the software—for example, 30 to 40 kg—to match your preferred driving feel.

Hi

Thank you for the quick response.
What do you mean by this: '' The brake pedal allows you to adjust the
travel range by modifying the mechanical limit.''?

Additionally, i turned the brake force down to minimum of 15kg, and still
feels like i'm pushing at 70kg force.

Kind regards,

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (
Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,     After you modify the kg value, it will turn red to indicate that you need to press the Enter key on your keyboard to confirm the change and apply it immediately.

Hi

Additional question.
If i've connected the pedal's grounding wire to one of the pedal attachment
bolts on the wheelstand, can i also bolt the pedal's controlbox to the same
wheelstand? The controlbox is also made of metal, so that's why i'm asking.

Best,

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (
Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,  No problem at all, rest assured.

Dear Simsonn team

I have now had your pedals for a while.
I have Lenovo legion 5 pro, steelseries arctis 5 (wireless headset),
simagic alpha mini wheelbase and simagic gt neo wheel. In addition the
Simsonn Plus X pedals. I attached the grounding wire to the rig, under the
same bolt with the brake pedal and the control box is also bolted to the
rig. (See image below)

There is some kind of interference. As soon as i turn on the
Simsonn software, the headphones start cracking, the wheel's rev meter
freezes/stops working at a random time in game etc.

What could be the issue?

Kind regards,
[image: image.png]

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,  This issue is caused by EMI interference from the wheelbase. Please follow the steps below to troubleshoot and resolve it. Most customers with similar setups (such as Fanatec, MOZA, and T500 users) have resolved the problem using this method.     To address EMI (Electromagnetic Interference) issues, please follow the steps below to improve device stability and USB connection reliability:     1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding.     2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive.     3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup.     4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.     5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.     6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference.     7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements.     8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi

I tested by connecting the pedals alone and switching off the wheelbase.
Even with the base and wheel switched off, the interference was there, so
it is purely caused by the pedals alone. Regarding the recommended fixes:
  1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a
three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide
grounding.
This is not possible since I live in Estonia and we use the regular EU
outlets.
    2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the
metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any
metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and
conductive.
There is paint on the black Simsonn Plus X pedal that the grounding wire is
attached to. Otherwise it is grounded as shown in the picture i sent in my
previous email.
    3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to
connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground
to discharge static buildup.
This is not possible, since I use a laptop as stated in my previous email.
The base is attached to a metal wheelstand though and after every time i
use it, i fold it and put it away. Mobility is important.
    4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from
high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where
possible.
    5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB
3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.
Tested both, by connecting to USB 3.0 ports directly and to a unpowered USB
HUB. Interference is still there.
    6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to
high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency
interference.
The USB cables that came with Simsonn pedals and Simagic wheelbase, both
have ferrite cores attached to them.
    7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and
firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI
handling improvements.
Simsonn software and firmware are updated.
    8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue,
using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power
and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.

I am getting really frustrated. Are there any other fixes or where can I
find the refund policy?

Kind regards,

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,  If the issue no longer occurs after turning off the base, it indicates that the interference is coming from the base. We suggest trying to remove the paint under the pedal spacer to ensure proper grounding. The issue you reported has not been observed with other customers. In one previous case, a customer experienced interference with headphones, which was ultimately traced back to excessive power from the graphics card.

The issue does occur even after the base is switched off, so that is not
the issue.
I will try to scrub off some paint on the pedals and get back to you if
there is no improvement.

Kind regards,

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

Hi

I checked with the multimeter, that the grounding works even without
scrubbing the paint off the pedals.
Additionally added a few ferrite cores - 1 to monitor cable, additional one
to the other end of the pedals' USB cable.

Issue still persists.

What next?

Best,

Kontakt Tanel Kobrusepp (<tanel.kobrusepp@gmail.com>) kirjutas kuupäeval E,

你好，Tanel Kobrusepp，     Please install the Todesk software first. No registration is required — if you see a registration prompt, simply click the close button at the top right corner.  We can schedule a time tomorrow (Monday) based on your local time, and I will assist you remotely to troubleshoot the issue.         https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

Hi

I can share the screen over a videocall, but can not install the remote
desktop app.
How about monday (15.09) at 11AM CEST or tuesday (16.09) 11AM CEST?

Kind regards,

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,  One issue is that the video is very laggy, and another is that communication may not be smooth due to language barriers. Using ToDesk would be much more convenient, as I can directly perform remote operations and check the issue myself.

Hi

Unfortunately it is not possible to install such software on the computer.
Please offer an alternative solution.

Best

Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

turn on the Simsonn software without even connecting any of the pedals or
wheelbase to the computer or switching anything on.

Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,  If your PC headset keeps having issues, I recommend purchasing an inexpensive ADUM3160 USB isolator. It should help you resolve the problem physically in a simple way.             Also, please use SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1 (download link below):  ? https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mS9dS2GyzhRYo81BcmTIOXY1POa6RvST/view?usp=drive_link    Please follow the steps below:    Open SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1;    Click Revert on the interface;    Then click Save;    Finally, replug the USB cable, wait for the system to recognize the device, and then test the pedals again.    This process will reset the configuration and resolve potential signal issues.

Hi.

Tested the new software. The fix did not work.
Is there a third party software that is compatible with simpsonn pedals
that i could use?


Kontakt service@simsonn.com (

Hi Tanel Kobrusepp,     Please download and use the VKB JoyTester tool, then select the SIMSONN device for testing:    Press the pedals to run the test.    If only the X, Y, and Z axes appear (with no RX axis), and the curve follows your pedal movement normally without any extra data interference, then the pedals are functioning correctly.      https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0551/4739/7238/files/VKB_JoyTester_40fdd530-6057-437e-9b50-3ac2d59dbbcd.zip?v=1693176246
